reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: TB/HIV Epidemic Control in Malawi

description.narrative: Malawi - TB/HIV. This program has the following goals: Reduce TB incidence to 102/100000 by 2025. Reduce TB mortality to 18/100,000 pop by 2025. The goal of the 2020-2025 HIV and AIDS program is to contribute towards ending HIV and AIDS as a public health threat in Malawi by 2030. The objectives of this program are: Increase TB treatment coverage for drug susceptible TB to 90% (2025). 99% of co-infected TB/HIV patients receive ART by end of 2024. The TB case notification through PPM increase to 30% by 2025. Reduce new HIV infections from 33,000 in 2019 to 11,000 in 2025.. Reduce HIV and AIDS related morbidity and mortality from 68/100,000 population in 2019 to 63/100,000 population in 2024. Reach 95-95-95 treatment targets by December 2023. Improve the quality of TB and HIV services.. Build resilient health and social welfare systems for effectively responding to the TB and HIV epidemic.

title.narrative: Impact indicator for MWI-C-WVM
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Percentage of people living with HIV
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Coverage / Output indicator for MWI-C-WVM
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of young people aged 10-24 years attending school reached by compehensive sexuality education and/or life skills-based HIV education in schools
Number of adolescent girls and young women who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women reached with HIV prevention programs- defined package of services
Outcome indicator for MWI-C-WVM
Active health workers per 10,000 population
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated

Percentage of people living with HIV not on ART at the end of the reporting period among people living with HIV who were either on ART at the end of the last reporting period or newly initiated on ART during the reporting period
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of women aged 15-24 who had 2+ partners in the past 12 months
Proportion of ever-married or partnered women aged 15-49 who experienced physical or sexual violence from a male intimate partner in the past 12 months
Percentage of women aged 15-19 who have had a live birth or are currently pregnant
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
